title: Perla
description: A Node'less dev server for frontend developers

index.description: The main index file to be processed by perla, this file should be outside of the static mounted paths.

runConfiguration.description: Whether perla runs in production or dev mode, production is (and should be) the default

plugins.description: The list of plugins to use by perla, if the list is not specified, the default esbuild plugin will be used

mountDirectories.description: A key/value object that mounts the physical path specified by the key on the route specified by the value.

enableEnv.description: Enable providing environmental variables at dev time

envPath.description: Select the rooted url where to serve the env vars for perla e.g /my-api/env.js

dependencies.description: An array of dependencies of this

devDependencies.description: The main index file to be processed by perla, this file should be outside of the static mounted paths.

packages.description: A list of third party packages with the URL to their source, the key of the object can be any string, not necessarily the name of the package. This is used to generate an import map for the browser

testing.description: Configuration to run perla's testing features powered by playwright

browsers.description: browsers to run the testing suites with

includes.description: A relative path or globbing pattern to include test files

excludes.description: A relative path or globbing pattern to exclude test files

watch.description: Run the tests in watch mode (re-run on change)

headless.description: Run the browser without or with a GUI Display (window)

browserMode.description: How should the test suites run with several browsers

autoStart.description: Enable/Disable the Fable compilation at the start of the dev server

project.description: A relative path to the Fable project to compile

extension.description: The extension to use for compiled js files

outDir.description: A relative path that tells to output the js files

devServer.description: Configuration options for the saturn server running on the background at dev time

host.description: A host to bind the dev server to, defaults to localhost

port.description: A port to listen connections at for the dev server

useSSL.description: Enable SSL and HSTS for Local development

proxy.description: A mapping object between browser URLs -> Server URL for development

autoStart.description: Enable/Disable the saturn server auto start feature

mountDirectories.description: A key/value object that mounts the physical path specified by the key on the route specified by the value.

enableEnv.description: Enable providing environmental variables at dev time

envPath.description: Select the rooted url where to serve the env vars for perla e.g /my-api/env.js

watchConfig.description: Modify the way files are watched in the system

extensions.description: A list of extensions to watch for changes

directories.description: A list of directories to watch for changes

esBuildPath.description: An absolute path to the esbuild executable, on Windows it must include the .exe extension.

version.description: A Semantic versioning  *version* of an esbuild release, this must match a package in the npm js registry

ecmaVersion.description: Any target defined by esbuild, check https://esbuild.github.io/api/#target

injects.description: A list of files to inject at the transformation phase, this is injected only at build time

externals.description: Third party libraries that you want esbuild to ignore (i.e. bare specifiers), eg. excluding lit from the bundle from "import { LitElement from 'lit'" by default perla excludes all of the specifiers that are in the packages map.

fileLoaders.description: An object with file extensions and the kind of loaders you want for them see https://esbuild.github.io/content-types  providing these options will override the defaults, please ensure your options are covered when building for the first time

jsxAutomatic.description: Tells esbuild to automatically inject the jsx function helpers h and Fragment and react equivalents

jsxImportSource.description: Tells esbuild to set the source of the jsx helper imports e.g. Do not set it if you're using react

build.description: Configurations for perla's production build features

outDir.description: A relative path that tells to output the js files

includes.description: A relative path or glob that indicates file to copy

excludes.description: A relative path or glob that indicates file to exclude while copying files

esBuildPath.description: An absolute path to the esbuild executable, on Windows it must include the .exe extension.

esbuildVersion.description: A Semantic versioning  *version* of an esbuild release, this must match a package in the npm js registry

copyPaths.description: Include/Exclude content to be copied to the final bundle

includes.description: Files/directories to include in the out directory

excludes.description: Files/directories to exclude from the out directory, this will override the default exclude list.

target.description: Any target defined by esbuild, check https://esbuild.github.io/api/#target

format.description: Any format defined by esbuild, check https://esbuild.github.io/api/#format

jsxFactory.description: This sets the function that is called for each JSX element.

jsxFragment.description: This sets the function that is called for each JSX fragment.

externals.description: Third party libraries that you want esbuild to ignore (i.e. bare specifiers), eg. excluding lit from the bundle from "import { LitElement from 'lit'" by default perla excludes all of the specifiers that are in the packages map.

injects.description: A list of files to inject at the transformation phase, i.e import React from 'react' or import { h, Fragment } from 'preact', so you don't have to do it by hand on every file

fileLoaders.description: An object with file extensions and the kind of loaders you want for them see https://esbuild.github.io/content-types  providing these options will override the defaults, please ensure your options are covered when building for the first time
